results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
results.description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Craig Walsh
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.title: Blood disco: Dirk wears white socks
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Scott Redford
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.
results.description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guo Jian
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Cherine Fahd
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
results.description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.

results.title: 50 years of cardiology
results.brief_description: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.
results.description: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.
description_for_label: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: The Boy from Taurianova
results.brief_description: Rocco arrived from Calabria in 1962 at the age of 19 and immediately started his working life on a potato farm in Ballarat. He lovingly dedicates this story of his life to his daughter Connie. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
results.description: Rocco arrived from Calabria in 1962 at the age of 19 and immediately started his working life on a potato farm in Ballarat. results.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
results.brief_description: Giovanni was working on an olive farm as a teenager when he was suddenly called home - he was leaving for Australia in 2 hours! In this story he tells of his life since that day and how he became a political figure in his new homeland. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
